content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you can do it in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:AbstractFloat}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

Base.show(io::IO, f::FloatWithUnits) = print(io, "$(f.value) $(f.unit)")
```
In this code snippet, we define a struct `FloatWithUnits` with two fields: `value` and `unit`. We also implement the `Base.show` function for this type which will print the value and unit in the format you specified (e.g., "1.8 meters").
